author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Red Sparrow’ Review: Flightless Bird
text: After less than eight years of stardom, Jennifer Lawrence’s career is studded with comic triumphs and depictions of epic suffering. (Her suffering in “Winter’s Bone,” her first starring role, was stirring for being understated, unlike the spectacular trials she endured as Katniss Everdeen in “The Hunger Games” series.) No one can touch her when her gift for sparkling comedy intersects with great material, as in two of the three films she made with David O. Russell, “Silver Linings Playbook” and “American Hustle.” Still, she’s taking—and giving—punishment again in “Red Sparrow.” She plays a Russian ballerina, Dominika...
